topic.title: could Zeronet host a decentralized "Backpage" ?
topic.body: many sexworkers are unable to do business in the US due to the new law banning advertising or even discussing sex work online.  how could Zeronet take up the slack here?

1524150545_1ErQYVi5mdM9hGb6uT4jg8iwGxcJB.body: is there a scientific term for the disorder whereby self-identified "white" people think they are somehow better than everybody else?

> [styromaniac](#comment_270_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): There's not a long enough timeline of isolation where chromosome pair numbers would change and demonstrate increased adaptation to their local environments in modern civilization. That is a big indicator of genetic compatibility. Our DNA is 99.9% the same all around. Some of us are more Neanderthal than others, but we have a limit of delta there. It's possible that my family is on the higher side of Neanderthal DNA considering how our immune systems work, my parents are short and I'm the one with the biggest skull out of everyone in this town. [...]

1557337953_12V9AjYgcFFTD5rF89JUNqYcQTm2k.body: it's a pretty despicable thing to say in any case, and  reeks of mysogyny.  a person who says such things or agrees with them has no business representing people in a democracy.

> [sinewave](#comment_17_14DUMcwNfigWkHzZwwZ2wX9AfiPxxVzYbR): Sargon's trying to pull a Trump media maneuver. Leverage the media to platform him and promote his message even whilst they try to smear him. Using the, "It's better to be talked about than not talked about at all" mentality and all that.  [...]

i wonder if you would consider that Trump is actually a racist,  incompetent sociopath. sometimes the easiest explanation is the correct one.

> [geekosan](#comment_30_12V9AjYgcFFTD5rF89JUNqYcQTm2knBnq4): You think Jess Philips didn't deserve that comment for laughing at male suicides. She's a misandrist and has no business representing people in a democracy.

yeah, i saw that video.  she wasn't laughing at men who committed suicide. she was laughing at the notion that men need a special day because in a patriarchal world every day is men's day.   you don't have to agree with that sentiment, but anyone who watches that video would understand the context.

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_275_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): I'd rape Benjamin precisely because he is so ugly. It would definitely be hate fucking. Like when an ugly avocado hooks up with an older uglier avocado......poof catharsis!

haha ok you win the thread, we can all go home now.

> [sinewave](#comment_18_14DUMcwNfigWkHzZwwZ2wX9AfiPxxVzYbR): I hope I'm wrong. I hope he succeeds in getting his point across. I really do, but I think he's underestimated the lengths his enemies will go to and not played this round particularly well (for the reasons mentioned in the original post). Time will tell.  [...]

i'd say he's the lowest common denominator vomited up by a system that is utterly broken and dying. or something like that.

> [sinewave](#comment_19_14DUMcwNfigWkHzZwwZ2wX9AfiPxxVzYbR): I agree that the system is utterly broken and dying, I just don't think that Trump was 'vomited up' by that same system. The establishment did all it could to try and block his election using everything they had, worldwide.  [...]

anyone who lived in NYC during the 80's and 90's knows that Trump is actually a bad person. notorious for ripping people off and doing hateful stuff.  He's the lowest common denominator that managed to slide into power because the power brokers' have lost control.

> [sinewave](#comment_20_14DUMcwNfigWkHzZwwZ2wX9AfiPxxVzYbR): With all due respect, all you seem to be doing when you criticize Trump is name-call and appeal to generalities ("Everybody knows" - Argumentum ad populum to be technical ). I'm no great fan of his but you're not exactly making your case well.  [...]

i dunno, guy makes light of murdering refugees at a public rally and i have to make a case that he's a bad person. yes, let's agree to disagree.

1574560433_1Gvs3AKBY5YjUMPchHuoQuAYnWApB.body: it's disappointing that given this opportunity for un-censorable free speech there are those who still choose to squander it with this idiotic nonsense.

> [nuttslammer](#comment_3_1Gvs3AKBY5YjUMPchHuoQuAYnWApBm1myY): It's sad that given the access to information that we have that some people still choose to believe everything they learn in Highschool history class.

high school history barely scrapes the surface of the stpry of mass murder of jews,gypsies and others in europe during ww2 at the hands of the fascists.

> [between2worlds](#comment_4_1L4PrPHHR8HnHUggZiEYr3VKZUkxAshbKV): If I consider ad hominems as "idiotic nonsense", I'd say you're the "squanderer".

i think it's fair to call holocaust deniers "idiots" . their defenders aren't much better.

> [styromaniac](#comment_1327_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It's okay to question historical narrative. With the way things had been going for the past few years, can you blame them?

sure, but if you then try to replace the narrative with something provably false that's on you, and makes you seem like an idiot.

> [styromaniac](#comment_1331_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): You're not helping your case by calling everyone an idiot. Try discussing the subject matter. [...]

for me to go to that trouble i would have to assume the other party is arguing in good faith.  seriously, at this point how much effort is warranted to convince anyone of the existance of the mass, scientifically planned extermination of people by the nazi's?
